Bananas

04 Aug 2023 üìñ 76 words ‚è± 0 minutes Jill Smith

A banana is an edible fruit ‚Äì botanically a berry ‚Äì produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called ‚Äúplantains‚Äù, distinguishing them from dessert bananas. The fruit is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich in starch covered with a rind, which may be green, yellow, red, purple, or brown when ripe.
